newsitem.title: USA: Columbia/HCA must wait on mergers - CNBC interview.
newsitem.headline: Columbia/HCA must wait on mergers - CNBC interview.

text.p: Columbia/HCA Healthcare Corp will have to wait on any merger discussions, said the company's new chief executive and chairman, Thomas Frist, in an interview broadcast Monday by CNBC.
"I don't think we can afford to look at any further mergers," Frist said in the television interview.

The report added that Frist views three tasks -- addressing the federal investigation of the company, enhancing shareholder value and improving patient care -- as paramount for the largest U.S. for-profit hospital company.
The company has been rumored to be in merger talks with Tenet Healthcare Corp. Both companies have refused to comment on the speculation.
Columbia/HCA shares were down 1-7/16 at 34-1/2 early Monday afternoon. Tenet dropped 15/16 at 29-5/8.
